\-Welcome to my home for the past millenium.
Mark's journal containing his notes on elements.
Elemental Enemies & Attacks: How Do They Interact?
\}Elements that are strong against another will do double damage.
When an element attacks an element that
is strong against it, it will do half damage.
Light and Dark are an exception.
Elemental Status Effects: Your Elemental Identity
\}Enemies with status effects will switch to that
element for damage calculations. Enemies that are
already elemental will have all elements in play
accounted for in the final calculation.
Multi-element calculations multiply together, so you
can use that to your advantage to dish out massive
damage. However, party members can be turned elemental
by these status effects as well, so be careful!
When switched to another element by an elemental
status effect, same-element attacks will do half
Additionally, element attacks will remove elemental
status effects they are strong against. The exception
to this is Fire, which will remove Water status effects.
\}Here are a few extra notes, as well as reminders of
previously stated important concepts. Refer to this
if you need a quick refresher on something important.
- Fire, Ice, Electric, Water, Earth, and Wind are
considered to be the "natural" elements. Light and
Dark, however, are considered the "pure" elements,
which is why they are seperated from the other six
elements on the chart. This is also why they are
- While there is technically a Physical element, which
is just non-elemental attacks, it has no weaknesses
or strenghts against other elements. However, some
enemies might be resistant against it, or even
\}- When an elemental enemy is hit with an attack that
matches its element, the attack will be absorbed,
healing it. The exception to this is the pure elements.
- Light/Dark will not absorb Light/Dark attacks, and
will instead halve the incoming damage.
- Fire attacks remove Water status effects.
The Village Headman's book containing information on equipment.
- Light Shield: Equippable by Knights, Clerics
\}As with anything, there are going to be exceptions
to these rules. However, they will hold true for
The rule of thumb is to simply check every member of
your party's equipment menu. Anything greyed out is
unusable, but if it's normal white text, you
\}Tap D / RIGHT ARROW when on an equipment slot to
see the current item's possible upgrades.
\}Tap A / LEFT ARROW when on an equipment slot to
see the current item's equipping restrictions.
# Tests to see if the player is indoors

# Additionally, hourly respawns will be processed
# If more than 24 hours have passed, set hours to 0
# If it's 21:00 - 23:59, make it night, as long as it's not already night
# If it's neither of the above time, make it day, as long as it's still night
# If indoors, remove the screen tint
# If outdoors, change the screen tint depending on the time of day
